vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.2.2; also called Harim at Neh.10.5; 12.15; Nehum at Neh.7.7;
§ Rehum = "compassion"
1) an man who returned from exile with Zerubbabel
1a) also 'Nehum'
2) a Levite of the family of Bani who assisted in rebuilding the walls of Jerusalem
3) one of the chiefs of the people who sealed the covenant with Nehemiah
4) a priest who returned from exile with Zerubbabel
vocabinfos._es_Definition: (a) נְחוּם   hombre; post exílico; (b)   gobernador; post exílico
vocabinfos._zh_tw_Definition:
利宏 这个陽性專有名詞在原文的意思是 "慈憐"
1) 與所羅巴伯一同歸回的一個人 (拉 2:2)
2) 一名祭司 (尼 12:3)
3) 利未人巴尼的兒子, 協助重建耶路撒冷的城牆 (尼 3:17)
4) 與尼希米簽約的一名首領 (尼 10:25)
5) 一名波斯官員 (拉 4:8,9,17,23)
vocabinfos._zh_Definition:
利宏 这个阳性专有名词在原文的意思是 "慈怜"
1) 与所罗巴伯一同归回的一个人 (拉 2:2)
2) 一名祭司 (尼 12:3)
3) 利未人巴尼的儿子, 协助重建耶路撒冷的城墙 (尼 3:17)
4) 与尼希米签约的一名首领 (尼 10:25)
5) 一名波斯官员 (拉 4:8,9,17,23)

vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of Exile and Return, first mentioned at Ezr.4.8
§ Rehum = "compassion"
a commander who wrote a letter to the king Artaxerxes in which he opposed the rebuilding of Jerusalem

A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.3.17;
son of: Bani (H1137L)
§ Rehum = "compassion"
a commander who wrote a letter to the king Artaxerxes in which he opposed the rebuilding of Jerusalem

A man living at the time of Exile and Return, only mentioned at Neh.10.25
§ Rehum = "compassion"
a commander who wrote a letter to the king Artaxerxes in which he opposed the rebuilding of Jerusalem
